content:
Zihang Lin is now a fourth-year undergraduate in the School of Computer Science at Fudan University in China. He was a Visiting Predoctoral Fellow in the Center for Science of Science and Innovation (CSSI) at the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University. He is actively seeking an opportunity to be a PhD student starting from Fall 2023, focusing on Computational Social Science, Science of Science, and Innovation.
Currently, he is engaged in large-scale scientific data processing and analyses of disparate data sources, trying to attain a deeper understanding of science and innovation, especially in capturing the relationships between scientific literature and other socioeconomic institutions from upstream funding sources to downstream public uses of science, such as patented inventions and clinical trials.
  Download my Curriculum Vitae.
summary: Zihang Lin is now a fourth-year undergraduate in the School of Computer Science at Fudan University in China. He was a Visiting Predoctoral Fellow in the Center for Science of Science and Innovation (CSSI) at the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.
title: Zihang Lin

summary: SciSciNet, a large-scale open data lake for the science of science research, covering 134M+ scientific publications and millions of external linkages to funding and public uses.
title: SciSciNet: A Large-Scale Open Data Lake for the Science of Science Research

summary: A comprehensive review on the foundation, detection and practical application of structural hole theory, facilitating researchers and developers to better apply structural hole theory and derive value-added tools.
title: Structural Hole Theory in Social Network Analysis: A Review

summary:
As the time lag between granted patents and cited scientific papers has increased over the past few decades, we are currently trying to predict tomorrow's patented inventions based on prior scientific knowledge, depicting the knowledge flow from scientific literature to the technological world.  
 This work is advised by Prof. [Yian Yin](https://www.yianyin.net/index.html) and Prof. [Dashun Wang](https://www.dashunwang.com/).
title: The Dual Frontier: How prior scientific knowledge predicts tomorrow's technological breakthroughs

summary:
A large-scale open data lake capturing the innerworkings of science, as well as millions of external linkages between scientific literature and other socioeconomic institutions from upstream major funding sources to downstream public uses of science, such as patents and clinical trials, to better facilitate large-scale data-driven research in the science of science.  
 This work is advised by Prof. [Yian Yin](https://www.yianyin.net/index.html) and Prof. [Dashun Wang](https://www.dashunwang.com/).
title: SciSciNet: A Large-Scale Open Data Lake for the Science of Science Research

summary:
Analyses of academic performance and collaboration patterns between scholars with diverse network positions, including structural hole scholars and opinion leaders.  
 This work is advised by Prof. [Qingyuan Gong](https://gongqingyuan.wordpress.com/) and Prof. [Yang Chen](https://chenyang03.wordpress.com/).
title: Empirical Analysis of Structural Hole Spanner Detection Methodologies in Coauthorship Networks

summary:
A comprehensive review on the foundation, detection and practical application of structural hole theory, facilitating researchers and developers to better apply structural hole theory and derive value-added tools.  
 The paper has been accepted by [IEEE Transactions on Computational Social Systems (TCSS)](https://ieeesmc.org/publications/transactions-on-computational-social-systems), and is advised by Prof. [Yang Chen](https://chenyang03.wordpress.com/), Prof. [Qingyuan Gong](https://gongqingyuan.wordpress.com/), Prof. [Aaron Yi Ding](https://homepage.tudelft.nl/8e79t/), and Prof. [Atte Oksanen](https://www.tuni.fi/en/atte-oksanen).
title: Review on Structural Hole Theory in Social Network Analysis
Visiting Predoctoral Fellowship, Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University
Second Prize, Scholarship for Students in Honor Class

content:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy Wowchemy | Documentation
 Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides   Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E   Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")   Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
 Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  **Two**  Three   A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears   Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view    Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links    night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links   Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}   Custom CSS Example Letâ€™s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }   Questions? Ask
Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Wowchemy's Slides feature.
title: Slides
Bronze Medal, National Olympiad in Informatics, National Finals (NOI Invitational)
Bronze Medal, Asian & Pacific Informatics Olympiad (APIO, China Division)
First Prize, National Olympiad in Informatics in Provinces (NOIP)
